author: Savannah Morning News
title: HIGH SCHOOL: Habersham downs St. Andrew's
text:
SPECIAL OFFER FOR NEW READERS 99 cent digital subscription to savannahnow.com
Subscriber-members get access to ALL our digital products AND become eligible for free event tickets, discount coupons and other benefits. SIGN UP FOR SUBSCRIBER BENEFITS As a Savannah Morning News / savannahnow.com subscriber, you're eligible for members-only discounts. Download your coupons now. By Savannah Morning News Habersham downs St. Andrew’s
Junior Ashlyn Burnsed had 37 assists and seven digs and Sara Delk had 21 kills and eight digs as Habersham beat St. Andrew’s in straight sets. Peyton Burnsed was 25 of 25 serving with five aces and seven digs and Abbey McIntyre added 13 kills, seven digs and six blocks for Habersham.
Habersham def. St. Andrew’s 25-20, 25-11, 25-18
Top players-Habersham, Ashlyn Burnsed 12/12, 2 aces, 37 assists, 7 digs; Sara Delk 21 kills, 8 digs; Abbey McIntyre 13 kills, 7 digs, 6 blocks; Peyton Burnsed 25/25, 5 aces, 7 digs. Record—Habersham 19-6, 6-0 in Region.
Bible Baptist def. Beaufort Academy 21-25, 25-16, 25-20, 25-11
Hannah Helm had 23 kills and 11 digs and Rebecca Conley dished out 36 assists with nine digs as Bible Baptist beat Beaufort Academy.
Top players-BB, Hannah Helm 23 kills, 11 digs, 6 aces; Rebecca Conley 36 assists, 9 digs; McCall Deere 18 digs, 2 kills; Katie Atkins 7 kills, 4 blocks. Record–BB 14-6, 8-4 in region.
Note—Bible Baptist opens in the SCISA playoffs next Wednesday.

Palmetto forfeits to Bethesda
Bethesda Academy’s football game set for Thursday against visiting Palmetto Christian has been cancelled as Palmetto forfeited. The Blazers are credited with the win and improve to 8-0 this season and 3-0 in SCISA Region 2-AA. The Blazers will play at Northwood Academy (6-1, 3-0) in the region title game set for Oct. 23.
Johnson HOF set for Oct. 24
The Sol C. Johnson High School Athletic Hall of Fame Association will hold its fourth annual Induction Ceremony and Banquet at 6:30 p.m. on October 24 at Johnson High School.
This event honors and celebrates the outstanding athletic accomplishments of students who attended Johnson High School. The Otis Brock III Award will be presented to the most scholarly athlete and 2015 Citation Honorees will also be announced. For ticket information, contact President Frank Ellis at 912-826-9785.
